cn.cnic.dataspace.api.ftp.minimalftp.api

Interface IUserAuthenticator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UserbaseAuthenticator

    public interface IUserAuthenticator
    Represents an user authenticator. You can implement your existing user database

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IUserAuthenticator.AuthException
      The exception that should be thrown when the authentication fails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean acceptsHost(FTPConnection con, java.net.InetAddress host)
      Whether the user is allowed to connect through the specified host.
      Control authenticate(FTPConnection con, java.net.InetAddress host, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Authenticates a user synchronously.
      boolean needsPassword(FTPConnection con, java.lang.String username, java.net.InetAddress host)
      Whether this authenticator requires a password.
      boolean needsUsername(FTPConnection con)
      Whether this authenticator requires a username.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptsHost

        default boolean acceptsHost(FTPConnection con,
                            java.net.InetAddress host)
        Whether the user is allowed to connect through the specified host. The client will not send the host address if needsUsername(FTPConnection) returns false or the client does not support custom hosts.
        Parameters:
        con - The FTP connection
        host - The host address
        Returns:
        Whether the specified host is accepted

      • needsUsername

        boolean needsUsername(FTPConnection con)
        Whether this authenticator requires a username.
        Parameters:
        con - The FTP connection
        Returns:
        true if this authenticator requires a username

      • needsPassword

        boolean needsPassword(FTPConnection con,
                      java.lang.String username,
                      java.net.InetAddress host)
        Whether this authenticator requires a password. Only affects when needsUsername(FTPConnection) is also true
        Parameters:
        con - The FTP connection
        username - The username
        host - The host address or null if it's not specified by the client
        Returns:
        true if this authenticator requires a password

      • authenticate

        Control authenticate(FTPConnection con,
                     java.net.InetAddress host,
                     java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws IUserAuthenticator.AuthException
        Authenticates a user synchronously. You can use a custom file system depending on the user. If the host is null, you can use a "default host" or a union of all hosts combined as some clients might not support custom hosts.
        Parameters:
        con - The FTP connection
        host - The host address or null when the client didn't specified the hostname
        username - The username or null when needsUsername(FTPConnection) returns false
        password - The password or null when needsPassword(FTPConnection, String, InetAddress) returns false
        Returns:
        A file system if the authentication succeeded
        Throws:
        IUserAuthenticator.AuthException - When the authentication failed
